text: How do I write to an HDF5 file?

elements.text: How do I write to an HDF5 file?

text: I should have been more specific: I have the HDF5 package and want to know the code I would need to write to record a nested array as one.

elements.text: I should have been more specific: I have the HDF5 package and want to know the code I would need to write to record a nested array as one.

text: It’s an array of arrays of arrays of coordinate triplets, each representing the position of a particle at a point in time corresponding to the array to which the triplet belongs.  The highest-level array is just the container for these time-slices.

elements.text: It’s an array of arrays of arrays of coordinate triplets, each representing the position of a particle at a point in time corresponding to the array to which the triplet belongs.  The highest-level array is just the container for these time-slices.

text: Sorry, never used the package myself, I use JLD/JLD2 usually

elements.text: Sorry, never used the package myself, I use JLD/JLD2 usually

text: <@U8HHPBKQR> What is the best tutorial for JLD2? :smiley:

elements.text: What is the best tutorial for JLD2?

text: I never do anything complicated, just `@save "example.jld2" hello foo`and `@load "example.jld2" hello foo`

elements.text: I never do anything complicated, just
@save "example.jld2" hello foo
and
@load "example.jld2" hello foo

text:
<@U8HHPBKQR> So, if I had a nested array named _arr_ I wanted to save to a new JLD2 file named _example_, I would write:

```@save “example.jld2” arr
```

elements.text: So, if I had a nested array named
arr
I wanted to save to a new JLD2 file named
example
, I would write:
@save “example.jld2” arr
yeah

text:
This will help, I hope.
```using JLD
x = [rand( -0.1:0.001:0.1)*one( Array{ComplexF64}(undef,2,2) ) for ik=1:10]

save("data.jld", "data", x)
y = load("data.jld")["data"]

y == x
# Should get true```

elements.text: This will help, I hope.

using JLD
x = [rand( -0.1:0.001:0.1)*one( Array{ComplexF64}(undef,2,2) ) for ik=1:10]

save("data.jld", "data", x)
y = load("data.jld")["data"]

y == x
# Should get true

text: <@U01H3MBQDDF> So, what if I have a ragged, multidimensional array?  Mine is an array, each element of which is an array of coordinates of every particle in a cheminformatic simulation at a time step.

elements.text: So, what if I have a ragged, multidimensional array?  Mine is an array, each element of which is an array of coordinates of every particle in a cheminformatic simulation at a time step.

text: Can I just cram-pack whatever I want into a JLD and just drag it out later, good as new?

elements.text: Can I just cram-pack whatever I want into a JLD and just drag it out later, good as new?

text: I guess so. You can try and see.

elements.text: I guess so. You can try and see.
